intro: Achillea latifolia, commonly known as broadleaf yarrow, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to Europe and western Asia and is characterized by its flat, composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–90 cm and features lance-shaped, gray-green leaves with a hairy texture. Its flowers bloom in shades of white, pink, or red, depending on the variety, and are often used in herbal medicine. Achillea latifolia is also valued in gardens for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
